etymology.description: Depicts a mortar for grinding grain
etymology.interpretation: The character 臼(臼) (jiù, 'a pair of hands') visually represents a mortar, which resembles an object where traditionally two hands might work to grind grains. It specifically captures the shape of a mortar with its hollow center.

examples.chinese: 妈妈的臼总能给予我温暖(媽媽的臼總能給予我溫暖)，让我的心灵得到抚慰(讓我的心靈得到撫慰)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā de jiù zǒng néng jǐyǔ wǒ wēnnuǎn, ràng wǒ de xīnlíng dédào fǔwèi.
examples.english: Mother's pair of hands always gives me warmth, soothing my soul.

examples.chinese: 在关键时刻(在關鍵時刻)，他的臼伸出了援手(他的臼伸出了援手)。
examples.pinyin: Zài guānjiàn shíkè, tā de jiù shēnchūle yuánshǒu.
examples.english: At a crucial moment, his pair of hands reached out to help.

examples.chinese: 运动员挥动臼大放异彩(運動員揮動臼大放異彩)。
examples.pinyin: Yùndòngyuán huīdòng jiù dà fàng yìcǎi.
examples.english: The athlete's waving pair of hands shone brilliantly.
